Key Match Events: Immanuel Quickley scored 12 of his 21 points in the fourth quarter
Bruno Fernando infused the team with the much-needed energy that allowed the Raptors to mount an 18-6 run in the fourth to tie the game
Norman Powell’s trifecta gave the Clippers a 100-95 lead with two minutes left
Quickley knotted the game at 102 with 35 seconds remaining
Powell split his freebie, but Quickley missed his layup on the other end
Harden was sent to the line with 28 seconds remaining, splitting his freebies and giving the Clippers a two-point lead
RJ Barrett’s turn to miss his layup, and they sent Powell to the line with 8.1 seconds remaining
Powell split his freebies again, giving the Clippers a 105-102 lead
Coach Darko called for time and drew up for Poeltl to get the inbounds pass, not once, but twice, as the Clippers strategically wanted to ‘foul up three’
Poeltl made his first shot and strategically missed the second
The ball bounced hard enough for Poeltl to grab the board, which he tried to put back right away instead of kicking it out
Post-Match Reflections: The Raptors drop their third straight loss, tanking their record to 2-8 through ten games, and first team in the NBA to lose 8 games
They are also winless on the road (0-5)
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bruno Fernando was a revelation in this game, as he infused the team with the much-needed energy that allowed the Raptors to mount an 18-6 run in the fourth to tie the game
The Clippers’ foul-bait duo Norman Powell and his Robin James Harden led all scorers with 24 points apiece, combining for 22 free throws in this game, 1 more than the Raptors combined
Others: The Raptors suffered a heartbreaking 103-105 loss to the Los Angeles Clippers in a game they had a chance to steal
Several questionable coaching decisions and team management issues, especially in the final moments, proved costly, allowing the hosts to escape with a victory
